FuncDef:
The service force redirect command configures a forcible redirection profile for a service policy.
The undo service force redirect command restores the default configuration.
By default, no forcible redirection profile is configured for a service policy.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a forcible redirection profile.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, the device redirects a user to a quota notification page only when receiving a zero quota from a policy server. To enable the device to perform the redirection when the quota usage reaches a specified threshold, run the service force redirect command. Then, the device redirects a user immediately when the quota usage threshold is reached, without waiting for a zero quota from the policy server.
Prerequisites
A redirection profile has been configured using the http-redirect-profile <redirect-profile-name> command.
Configuration Impact
After the service force redirect command is run, the prepaid function of the service policy becomes ineffective.
Precautions
The HTTP redirection profile bound to the service policy template can be deleted only after the binding relationship has been canceled.
The service force redirect command is mutually exclusive with the http-redirect-profile <profile-name> command.
